TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Run extends System.Windows.Documents.Inline

Docs.summary: An inline-level flow content element intended to contain a run of formatted or unformatted text.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Starting in the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/add/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)], the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run.Text%2A> property of the Run object is a dependency property, which means that you can bind the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run.Text%2A> property to a data source. The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run.Text%2A> property fully supports one-way binding in <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReader> and other controls that display read-only text. For more information about data binding, see [Data Binding Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
> [!NOTE] > Binding text to a Run object contained within <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RichTextBox> is not supported. Editing operations within the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RichTextBox> may cause the binding to be cleared.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new, default instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string text) cil managed

Docs.param: A string specifying the initial contents of the object.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, taking a specified string as the initial contents of the text run.

Docs.param: A string specifying the initial contents of the object.
A specifying an insertion position at which to insert the text run after it is created, or for no automatic insertion.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, taking a specified string as the initial contents of the text run, and a specifying an insertion position for the text run.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ShouldSerializeText(class System.Windows.Markup.XamlDesignerSerializationManager manager) cil managed

Docs.param: A serialization service manager object for this object.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether or not the effective value of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run.Text%2A> property should be serialized during serialization of a object.
Docs.returns: if the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run.Text%2A> property should be serialized; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the unformatted text contents of this text .
Docs.value: A string that specifies the unformatted text contents of this text . The default is <xref:System.String.Empty>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Starting in the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_short](~/add/includes/net-v40-short-md.md)], the Text property of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run> object is a dependency property, which means that you can bind the Text property to a data source. The Text property fully supports one-way binding in <xref:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReader> and other controls that display read-only text. For more information about data binding, see [Data Binding Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
> [!NOTE] > Binding text to a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run> object contained within <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RichTextBox> is not supported. Editing operations within the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.RichTextBox> may cause the binding to be cleared.
## Examples The following example shows how to set the Text attribute of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run> element directly and by using binding.
[!code-xml[BindableRunSnippet#BindableRun](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/p-system.windows.documen_155_1.xaml)] [!code-xml[BindableRunSnippet#BindableRun](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/bindablerunsnippet/window1.xaml#bindablerun)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Windows.DependencyProperty TextProperty
